articles.title: –†—É–∫–æ–≤–æ–¥—Å—Ç–≤–æ –ø–æ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏—é —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Å–ª–∞–≤–∏—Ç—Å—è —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –º–µ–ª–æ–¥–∏—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é –∏ —ç–ª–µ–≥–∞–Ω—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å—é. –î–ª—è —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä—è—â–∏—Ö –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –∑–≤—É–∫–∏ –±—É–¥—É—Ç –Ω–µ–ø—Ä–∏–≤—ã—á–Ω—ã–º–∏, –Ω–æ —Å –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–æ–π –≤—ã –æ—Å–≤–æ–∏—Ç–µ –∏—Ö!

## –ù–æ—Å–æ–≤—ã–µ –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω—ã–µ

–≠—Ç–æ —É–Ω–∏–∫–∞–ª—å–Ω–∞—è –æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ ‚Äî –∑–≤—É–∫–∏, –ø—Ä–∏ –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã—Ö –≤–æ–∑–¥—É—Ö –ø—Ä–æ—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –Ω–æ—Å.

<VocabCard
  word="on, an, in, un"
  translation="–Ω–æ—Å–æ–≤—ã–µ –∑–≤—É–∫–∏"
  pronunciation="–æ–Ω, –∞–Ω, —ç–Ω, —ë–Ω"
  example="mon [–º–æ–Ω], dans [–¥–∞–Ω], vin [–≤—ç–Ω], un [—ë–Ω]"
/>

### –ß–µ—Ç—ã—Ä–µ –Ω–æ—Å–æ–≤—ã—Ö –∑–≤—É–∫–∞:

| –ù–∞–ø–∏—Å–∞–Ω–∏–µ | –ó–≤—É–∫ | –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä |
|-----------|------|--------|
| **on, om** | [–æ–Ω] | mon, nom, bon |
| **an, am, en, em** | [–∞–Ω] | dans, chambre, enfant |
| **in, im, ain, ein** | [—ç–Ω] | vin, impossible, main |
| **un, um** | [—ë–Ω] | un, parfum |

**–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å**: –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å–∏—Ç–µ –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω—É—é –∏ –Ω–∞–ø—Ä–∞–≤—å—Ç–µ –≤–æ–∑–¥—É—Ö —á–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –Ω–æ—Å, –∫–∞–∫ –±—É–¥—Ç–æ —É –≤–∞—Å –Ω–∞—Å–º–æ—Ä–∫, –Ω–æ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ "–Ω" –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ!

<CultureTip title="–°–µ–∫—Ä–µ—Ç –Ω–æ—Å–æ–≤—ã—Ö" flag="üá´üá∑">
–ù–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ –±—É–∫–≤—É "n" –∏–ª–∏ "m"! "Bon" ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ [–±–æ–Ω], –≥–¥–µ "–æ–Ω" ‚Äî –µ–¥–∏–Ω—ã–π –Ω–æ—Å–æ–≤–æ–π –∑–≤—É–∫, –∞ –Ω–µ [–±–æ-–Ω] —Å –æ—Ç–¥–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º "–Ω".
</CultureTip>

## –ó–≤—É–∫ [R] ‚Äî —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–µ "—Ä"

<VocabCard
  word="rouge, Paris, amour"
  translation="–∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã–π, –ü–∞—Ä–∏–∂, –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å"
  pronunciation="—Ä—É–∂, –ø–∞—Ä–∏, –∞–º—É—Ä"
  example="–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–µ R ‚Äî –≥–æ—Ä–ª–æ–≤–æ–µ, –Ω–µ —Ä–∞—Å–∫–∞—Ç–∏—Å—Ç–æ–µ"
/>

–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–µ "r" –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—Å—è –≤ –≥–æ—Ä–ª–µ, –ø–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ –Ω–∞ –ª—ë–≥–∫–æ–µ –ø–æ–ª–æ—Å–∫–∞–Ω–∏–µ:
- –ù–µ –∏—Å–ø–æ–ª—å–∑—É–π—Ç–µ —Ä–∞—Å–∫–∞—Ç–∏—Å—Ç–æ–µ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–µ "—Ä"
- –ó–≤—É–∫ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑—É–µ—Ç—Å—è –≤ –∑–∞–¥–Ω–µ–π —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏ –≥–æ—Ä–ª–∞
- –ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ –Ω–∞ –º—è–≥–∫–æ–µ "—Ö" –∏–ª–∏ "–≥"

–°–ª–æ–≤–∞ –¥–ª—è –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏:
- **rouge** [—Ä—É–∂] ‚Äî –∫—Ä–∞—Å–Ω—ã–π
- **Paris** [–ø–∞—Ä–∏] ‚Äî –ü–∞—Ä–∏–∂
- **amour** [–∞–º—É—Ä] ‚Äî –ª—é–±–æ–≤—å

## –ó–≤—É–∫ [y] ‚Äî –º–µ–∂–¥—É "–∏" –∏ "—é"

<VocabCard
  word="tu, du, lune"
  translation="—Ç—ã, –æ—Ç/–∏–∑, –ª—É–Ω–∞"
  pronunciation="—Ç—é, –¥—é, –ª—é–Ω"
  example="–ì—É–±—ã –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è '—É', —è–∑—ã–∫ –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è '–∏'"
/>

**–ö–∞–∫ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å**: –°–ª–æ–∂–∏—Ç–µ –≥—É–±—ã –∫–∞–∫ –¥–ª—è –∑–≤—É–∫–∞ "—É", –Ω–æ –ø–æ–ø—Ä–æ–±—É–π—Ç–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–µ—Å—Ç–∏ "–∏".

| –°–ª–æ–≤–æ | –ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ |
|-------|--------------|
| tu | —Ç—é |
| du | –¥—é |
| lune | –ª—é–Ω |
| rue | —Ä—é |

## –ó–≤—É–∫ [≈ì] ‚Äî –∫–∞–∫ –≤ —Å–ª–æ–≤–µ "c≈ìur"

<VocabCard
  word="c≈ìur, s≈ìur, ≈ìuf"
  translation="—Å–µ—Ä–¥—Ü–µ, —Å–µ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞, —è–π—Ü–æ"
  pronunciation="–∫—ë—Ä, —Å—ë—Ä, —ë—Ñ"
  example="–ü–æ—Ö–æ–∂–µ –Ω–∞ —Ä—É—Å—Å–∫–æ–µ '—ë', –Ω–æ –±–æ–ª–µ–µ –æ—Ç–∫—Ä—ã—Ç–æ–µ"
/>

## –ó–≤—É–∫ [√∏] ‚Äî –∑–∞–∫—Ä—ã—Ç—ã–π –≤–∞—Ä–∏–∞–Ω—Ç

<VocabCard
  word="deux, bleu, jeu"
  translation="–¥–≤–∞, —Å–∏–Ω–∏–π, –∏–≥—Ä–∞"
  pronunciation="–¥—ë, –±–ª—ë, –∂—ë"
  example="–ì—É–±—ã –æ–∫—Ä—É–≥–ª–µ–Ω—ã, –∑–≤—É–∫ –º–µ–∂–¥—É '–æ' –∏ '—ç'"
/>

## –ù–µ–º—ã–µ –±—É–∫–≤—ã

–í–æ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–º –º–Ω–æ–≥–∏–µ –±—É–∫–≤—ã –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å—è—Ç—Å—è!

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Je t'aime beaucoup"
  translation="–Ø —Ç–µ–±—è –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –ª—é–±–ª—é"
  pronunciation="–∂—ë —Ç—ç–º –±–æ–∫—É"
  context="–ë—É–∫–≤—ã –Ω–∞ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å—è—Ç—Å—è"
/>

### –ü—Ä–∞–≤–∏–ª–∞ –Ω–µ–º—ã—Ö –±—É–∫–≤:

1. **–ö–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–∞—è -e** –æ–±—ã—á–Ω–æ –Ω–µ–º–∞—è: belle [–±—ç–ª—å], aime [—ç–º]
2. **–ö–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω—ã–µ —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω—ã–µ** —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –Ω–µ–º—ã–µ: petit [–ø—ë—Ç–∏], beaucoup [–±–æ–∫—É]
3. **-ent** –≤ –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª–∞—Ö –Ω–µ–º–æ–µ: ils aiment [–∏–ª—å –∑—ç–º]

### –ò—Å–∫–ª—é—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ ‚Äî liaison (—Å–≤—è–∑—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ):

–ö–æ–Ω–µ—á–Ω–∞—è —Å–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–∞—è –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç—å—Å—è, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —Å–ª–µ–¥—É—é—â–µ–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ –Ω–∞—á–∏–Ω–∞–µ—Ç—Å—è —Å –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π:
- **les amis** [–ª–µ –∑–∞–º–∏] ‚Äî –¥—Ä—É–∑—å—è
- **nous aimons** [–Ω—É –∑—ç–º–æ–Ω] ‚Äî –º—ã –ª—é–±–∏–º

<CultureTip title="CAREFUL —Å liaison" flag="üá´üá∑">
–°–≤—è–∑—ã–≤–∞–Ω–∏–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏—Å—Ö–æ–¥–∏—Ç –Ω–µ –≤–µ–∑–¥–µ! –ú–µ–∂–¥—É –ø–æ–¥–ª–µ–∂–∞—â–∏–º –∏ –≥–ª–∞–≥–æ–ª–æ–º ‚Äî –¥–∞: "nous aimons". –ü–æ—Å–ª–µ —Å–æ—é–∑–∞ "et" ‚Äî –Ω–∏–∫–æ–≥–¥–∞: "toi et elle" [—Ç—É–∞ —ç —ç–ª—å].
</CultureTip>

## –°–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è –±—É–∫–≤

### –ì–ª–∞—Å–Ω—ã–µ —Å–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è:

| –°–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–µ | –ó–≤—É–∫ | –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä |
|-----------|------|--------|
| **ou** | [—É] | amour [–∞–º—É—Ä] |
| **au, eau** | [–æ] | beau [–±–æ] |
| **ai, ei** | [—ç] | j'aime [–∂—ç–º] |
| **oi** | [—É–∞] | toi [—Ç—É–∞] |
| **eu** | [—ë/—ç] | deux [–¥—ë] |

### –°–æ–≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω—ã–µ —Å–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏—è:

| –°–æ—á–µ—Ç–∞–Ω–∏–µ | –ó–≤—É–∫ | –ü—Ä–∏–º–µ—Ä |
|-----------|------|--------|
| **ch** | [—à] | ch√©ri [—à–µ—Ä–∏] |
| **gn** | [–Ω—å] | magnifique [–º–∞–Ω—å–∏—Ñ–∏–∫] |
| **qu** | [–∫] | que [–∫—ë] |
| **ph** | [—Ñ] | t√©l√©phone [—Ç—ç–ª–µ—Ñ–æ–Ω] |

## –£–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –∏–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è

### –£–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–º —Å–ª–æ–≥–µ!

<VocabCard
  word="amour, Paris, magnifique"
  translation="–ª—é–±–æ–≤—å, –ü–∞—Ä–∏–∂, –≤–µ–ª–∏–∫–æ–ª–µ–ø–Ω—ã–π"
  pronunciation="–∞–º–£–†, –ø–∞—Ä–ò, –º–∞–Ω—å–∏—Ñ–ò–ö"
  example="–£–¥–∞—Ä–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≤—Å–µ–≥–¥–∞ –Ω–∞ –ø–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–µ–º –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏–º–æ–º —Å–ª–æ–≥–µ"
/>

### –ò–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è:

- **–£—Ç–≤–µ—Ä–∂–¥–µ–Ω–∏—è** ‚Äî –∏–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è –ø–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç –≤ –∫–æ–Ω—Ü–µ ‚Üò
- **–í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã –¥–∞/–Ω–µ—Ç** ‚Äî –∏–Ω—Ç–æ–Ω–∞—Ü–∏—è —Ä–∞—Å—Ç—ë—Ç ‚Üó
- **–í–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å—ã —Å –≤–æ–ø—Ä–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º–∏ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞–º–∏** ‚Äî –ø–∞–¥–∞–µ—Ç ‚Üò

## –≠–ª–∏–∑–∏—è (–≤—ã–ø–∞–¥–µ–Ω–∏–µ –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π)

<VocabCard
  word="je + aime = j'aime"
  translation="—è + –ª—é–±–ª—é = —è –ª—é–±–ª—é"
  pronunciation="–∂—ç–º"
  example="L'amour, j'adore, c'est"
/>

–ü–µ—Ä–µ–¥ –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω–æ–π –∏–ª–∏ –Ω–µ–º–æ–π h –Ω–µ–∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ —Å–ª–æ–≤–∞ —Ç–µ—Ä—è—é—Ç –≥–ª–∞—Å–Ω—É—é:
- **le + amour = l'amour** [–ª—è–º—É—Ä]
- **je + aime = j'aime** [–∂—ç–º]
- **ce + est = c'est** [—Å—ç]

## –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–∏–µ —É–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏—è –¥–ª—è –ø–∞—Ä

### –°–∫–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∏:

<VocabCard
  word="Un chasseur sachant chasser"
  translation="–û—Ö–æ—Ç–Ω–∏–∫, —É–º–µ—é—â–∏–π –æ—Ö–æ—Ç–∏—Ç—å—Å—è"
  pronunciation="—ë–Ω —à–∞—Å—ë—Ä —Å–∞—à–∞–Ω —à–∞—Å—ç"
  example="–ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫—É–µ—Ç –∑–≤—É–∫ [—à]"
/>

–î—Ä—É–≥–∏–µ —Å–∫–æ—Ä–æ–≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∫–∏:
- **"Les chaussettes de l'archiduchesse"** ‚Äî –¥–ª—è [—à]
- **"Trois tortues trottaient"** ‚Äî –¥–ª—è [r]

### –£–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ ¬´–ú–∏–Ω–∏–º–∞–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ –ø–∞—Ä—ã¬ª:

–û–¥–∏–Ω –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä –≥–æ–≤–æ—Ä–∏—Ç —Å–ª–æ–≤–æ, –¥—Ä—É–≥–æ–π –æ–ø—Ä–µ–¥–µ–ª—è–µ—Ç:
- **rue** [—Ä—é] vs **roue** [—Ä—É]
- **tu** [—Ç—é] vs **tout** [—Ç—É]
- **des** [–¥—ç] vs **deux** [–¥—ë]

### –£–ø—Ä–∞–∂–Ω–µ–Ω–∏–µ ¬´–ù–æ—Å–æ–≤—ã–µ –∑–≤—É–∫–∏¬ª:

–ü—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ –ø–æ –æ—á–µ—Ä–µ–¥–∏:
- **mon** [–º–æ–Ω] ‚Äî **main** [–º—ç–Ω] ‚Äî **ment** [–º–∞–Ω]
- **bon** [–±–æ–Ω] ‚Äî **bain** [–±—ç–Ω] ‚Äî **banc** [–±–∞–Ω]

## –°–æ–≤–µ—Ç—ã –ø–æ —É–ª—É—á—à–µ–Ω–∏—é

1. **–°–ª—É—à–∞–π—Ç–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫—É—é –º—É–∑—ã–∫—É** ‚Äî √âdith Piaf, Stromae, ZAZ
2. **–°–º–æ—Ç—Ä–∏—Ç–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–∏–µ —Ñ–∏–ª—å–º—ã** —Å —Å—É–±—Ç–∏—Ç—Ä–∞–º–∏
3. **–ü–æ–≤—Ç–æ—Ä—è–π—Ç–µ –∑–∞ –Ω–æ—Å–∏—Ç–µ–ª—è–º–∏** ‚Äî —Ç–µ—Ö–Ω–∏–∫–∞ shadowing
4. **–ó–∞–ø–∏—Å—ã–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ —Å–µ–±—è** –∏ —Å—Ä–∞–≤–Ω–∏–≤–∞–π—Ç–µ
5. **–ù–µ –±–æ–π—Ç–µ—Å—å** ‚Äî —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—ã —Ü–µ–Ω—è—Ç –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∫–∏!

<CultureTip title="–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–∏–π –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç ‚Äî —ç—Ç–æ —à–∞—Ä–º!" flag="üá´üá∑">
–õ—ë–≥–∫–∏–π –∏–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—Ä–∞–Ω–Ω—ã–π –∞–∫—Ü–µ–Ω—Ç –≤–æ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–º –º–æ–∂–µ—Ç –±—ã—Ç—å –æ—á–∞—Ä–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–º. –ì–ª–∞–≤–Ω–æ–µ ‚Äî –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å. –ù–µ —Å—Ç—Ä–µ–º–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å –∫ –∏–¥–µ–∞–ª—É, —Å—Ç—Ä–µ–º–∏—Ç–µ—Å—å –∫ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—é!
</CultureTip>

–§—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–µ –ø—Ä–æ–∏–∑–Ω–æ—à–µ–Ω–∏–µ —Ç—Ä–µ–±—É–µ—Ç –ø—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏–∫–∏, –Ω–æ —Ä–µ–∑—É–ª—å—Ç–∞—Ç —Ç–æ–≥–æ —Å—Ç–æ–∏—Ç. –ú–µ–ª–æ–¥–∏—á–Ω–æ—Å—Ç—å —ç—Ç–æ–≥–æ —è–∑—ã–∫–∞ –ø–æ–∫–æ—Ä–∏—Ç –∏ –≤–∞—Å, –∏ –≤–∞—à–µ–≥–æ –ø–∞—Ä—Ç–Ω—ë—Ä–∞!

## –ü—Ä–æ–¥–æ–ª–∂–∏—Ç—å –æ–±—É—á–µ–Ω–∏–µ

- **[–ù–µ–æ–±—Ö–æ–¥–∏–º—ã–µ —Ñ—Ä–∞–∑—ã](/learn/ru/fr/french-essential-phrases-for-couples/)** - –ü—Ä–∞–∫—Ç–∏—á–µ—Å–∫–æ–µ –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏–µ
- **[–ì—Ä–∞–º–º–∞—Ç–∏–∫–∞ —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–æ–≥–æ](/learn/ru/fr/french-grammar-basics/)** - –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤—ã —è–∑—ã–∫–∞
- **[–ü—Ä–∏–≤–µ—Ç—Å—Ç–≤–∏—è](/learn/ru/fr/french-greetings-farewells/)** - –û—Å–Ω–æ–≤—ã –æ–±—â–µ–Ω–∏—è
- **[–°–ª–æ–∂–Ω–æ –ª–∏ —É—á–∏—Ç—å —Ñ—Ä–∞–Ω—Ü—É–∑—Å–∫–∏–π?](/learn/ru/fr/is-french-hard-to-learn/)** - –ß–µ—Å—Ç–Ω—ã–π –∞–Ω–∞–ª–∏–∑

articles.title: Guten Morgen und Gute Nacht auf Ungarisch ‚Äì S√º√üe Phrasen f√ºr jeden Tag
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';
import CultureTip from '@components/CultureTip.astro';
import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';
import CTA from '@components/CTA.astro';

# Guten Morgen und Gute Nacht auf Ungarisch

Es gibt kaum etwas Sch√∂neres, als den Tag mit liebevollen Worten zu beginnen und zu beenden. Diese Ungarischen Phrasen helfen dir, deinem Partner jeden Tag zu zeigen, wie viel er dir bedeutet ‚Äì vom ersten Moment am Morgen bis zum letzten Kuss in der Nacht.

<PhraseOfDay
  word="Good morning"
  translation="Guten Morgen"
  pronunciation="gud MOR-ning"
  context="Der klassische Morgengru√ü f√ºr deinen Partner"
/>

## Guten Morgen sagen

### Klassische Morgengr√º√üe

<VocabCard
  word="Good morning, my darling"
  translation="Guten Morgen, mein Schatz"
  pronunciation="gud MOR-ning mai DAR-ling"
  example="Good morning, my darling! Rise and shine."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Wake up, my love"
  translation="Aufwachen, mein Liebling"
  pronunciation="weik ap mai lav"
  example="Wake up, my love! It's a beautiful day."
/>

| Ungarisch | Deutsch |
|-------------|---------|
| Did you sleep well? | Hast du gut geschlafen? |
| Time to get up | Zeit aufzustehen |
| I made breakfast | Ich habe Fr√ºhst√ºck gemacht |

### Romantische Morgengr√º√üe

| Ungarisch | Deutsch |
|-------------|---------|
| You're the first thing on my mind | Du bist das Erste, woran ich denke |
| Have a wonderful day, angel | Einen wundersch√∂nen Tag, mein Engel |
| I love waking up next to you | Ich liebe es, neben dir aufzuwachen |
| You're my sunshine | Du bist mein Sonnenschein |

<CultureTip flag="üá≠üá∫" title="Kultureller Kontext">
Daily greetings in your partner's language show you care. Make it a sweet habit!
</CultureTip>

## Gute Nacht sagen

### Klassische Nachtgr√º√üe

<VocabCard
  word="Good night"
  translation="Gute Nacht"
  pronunciation="gud nait"
  example="Good night, sweet dreams."
/>

<VocabCard
  word="Sleep well"
  translation="Schlaf gut"
  pronunciation="sliep wel"
  example="Sleep well, my love."
/>

| Ungarisch | Deutsch |
|-------------|---------|
| Sweet dreams | S√º√üe Tr√§ume |
| See you tomorrow | Bis morgen |
| Sleep tight | Schlaf sch√∂n |

### Romantische Nachtgr√º√üe

| Ungarisch | Deutsch |
|-------------|---------|
| I'll dream of you | Ich tr√§ume von dir |
| You're my last thought before sleep | Du bist der letzte Gedanke vor dem Einschlafen |
| Sleep well, my heart | Schlaf gut, mein Herz |
| I can't wait to see you tomorrow | Ich kann es kaum erwarten, dich morgen zu sehen |

## F√ºr Textnachrichten

Perfekt f√ºr s√º√üe SMS und WhatsApp-Nachrichten:

| Ungarisch | Deutsch |
|-------------|---------|
| Good morning, thinking of you | Guten Morgen, ich denke an dich |
| Have a great day | Hab einen tollen Tag |
| Good night, I miss you | Gute Nacht, ich vermisse dich |
| Sweet dreams | Tr√§um s√º√ü |
| Until tomorrow, love you | Bis morgen, ich liebe dich |

<CultureTip flag="üá≠üá∫" title="Tipp f√ºr Paare">
Beginne und beende jeden Tag mit einer liebevollen Nachricht auf Ungarisch. Diese kleinen Gesten st√§rken eure Beziehung und helfen dir beim Sprachenlernen!
</CultureTip>

## Verwandte Artikel

- [Romantische Phrasen auf Ungarisch](/de/blog/hungarian-romantic-phrases-for-every-occasion)
- [Ungarische Kosenamen](/de/blog/hungarian-pet-names-terms-of-endearment)

<CTA />

articles.title: Angol √údv√∂zl√©sek √©s B√∫cs√∫z√°sok: 40+ Kifejez√©s P√°roknak
articles.content:
import VocabCard from '@components/VocabCard.astro';

import PhraseOfDay from '@components/PhraseOfDay.astro';

Az √ºdv√∂zl√©sek √©s b√∫cs√∫z√°sok a mindennapi kommunik√°ci√≥ alapjai. Ha angol anyanyelv≈± p√°rod van, ezek a kifejez√©sek seg√≠tenek term√©szetesebben besz√©lni vele √©s a csal√°dj√°val. Ebben az √∫tmutat√≥ban megtanulod a legfontosabb form√°lis √©s k√∂zvetlen v√°ltozatokat.

Szeretn√©l romantikus kifejez√©seket is tanulni? N√©zd meg √∫tmutat√≥nkat: [hogyan mondd hogy szeretlek angolul](/learn/hu/en/how-to-say-i-love-you-in-english).

<PhraseOfDay

  pronunciation="gud MOR-ning, SZ√ÅN-s√°jn"

/>

## Reggeli √údv√∂zl√©sek

<VocabCard

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="How are you?">
Az angolokn√°l a "How are you?" nem igazi k√©rd√©s - ink√°bb √ºdv√∂zl√©s. A v√°lasz √°ltal√°ban "Good, thanks!" vagy "Fine, and you?" - nem v√°rnak r√©szletes v√°laszt!

## Napi √údv√∂zl√©sek

/>

| Angol | Magyar | St√≠lus |

| Hey | H√© | Nagyon k√∂zvetlen |
| Hello | Hell√≥ | Semleges |
| How are you? | Hogy vagy? | √Åltal√°nos |
| How's it going? | Hogy megy? | K√∂zvetlen |

<CultureTip flag="üá¨üáß" title="What's up?">
"What's up?" k√©rd√©sre a v√°lasz √°ltal√°ban "Not much" vagy "Nothing much" - nem kell r√©szletezni, mit csin√°lsz √©ppen!
</CultureTip>

## Esti √údv√∂zl√©sek

| Angol | Magyar |
|-------|--------|
| Good evening | J√≥ est√©t |
| How was your day? | Milyen volt a napod? |

| Good to see you | J√≥ l√°tni t√©ged |

<VocabCard
  word="How was your day?"
  translation="Milyen volt a napod?"
  pronunciation="hau voz jor DEJ"
  example="How was your day, love?"
  exampleTranslation="Milyen volt a napod, szerelmem?"
/>

## B√∫cs√∫z√°sok

### K√∂znapi B√∫cs√∫z√°sok

| Angol | Magyar |
|-------|--------|
| Bye | Szia |
| See you | Viszl√°t |
| See you later | K√©s≈ëbb tal√°lkozunk |
| Take care | Vigy√°zz magadra |
| Talk to you soon | Hamarosan besz√©l√ºnk |

### Romantikus B√∫cs√∫z√°sok

<VocabCard
  word="Goodnight, my love"
  translation="J√≥ √©jt, szerelmem"
  pronunciation="gud-N√ÅJT, m√°j lav"
  example="Goodnight, my love. Sweet dreams!"
  exampleTranslation="J√≥ √©jt, szerelmem. Sz√©p √°lmokat!"
/>

| Angol | Magyar |

| Goodnight, my love | J√≥ √©jt, szerelmem |
| Sweet dreams | Sz√©p √°lmokat |
| Sleep tight | Aludj j√≥l |

Tanulj meg t√∂bb kifejez√©st: [alapvet≈ë angol kifejez√©sek p√°roknak](/learn/hu/en/essential-english-phrases-for-couples).

## √ñsszefoglal√°s

Most m√°r ismered a legfontosabb angol √ºdv√∂zl√©seket √©s b√∫cs√∫z√°sokat! N√©h√°ny tipp:
- "How are you?" ink√°bb √ºdv√∂zl√©s, mint k√©rd√©s
- A k√∂zvetlen form√°k (Hi, Hey, Bye) √°ltal√°nosak
- Romantikus v√°ltozatokat haszn√°lj a p√°roddal

Gyakorolj minden nap a p√°roddal, √©s hamar term√©szetess√© v√°lik!

<CTA
  title="K√©szen √Ållsz T√∂bbet Tanulni?"

/>

articles.title: Roemeense Zinnen voor Ruzie en Meningsverschillen
articles.content:
Roemeni√´ is een land met een rijke cultuur en warme, expressieve mensen. Als je een Roemeense partner hebt, helpen deze zinnen je om ook tijdens moeilijke momenten verbonden te blijven.

## Roemeense communicatiestijl

Roemenen combineren Latijnse passie met Oost-Europese directheid. Ze zijn emotioneel expressief en hechten veel waarde aan familie en tradities. Gastvrijheid is een kernwaarde.

## Essenti√´le zinnen voor meningsverschillen

### 1. "MƒÉ simt rƒÉnit/ƒÉ c√¢nd tu..."
**Betekenis:** Ik voel me gekwetst als je...

**Uitspraak:** *muh simt ruh-niet/uh kund toe*

Gebruik "rƒÉnit" als man, "rƒÉnitƒÉ" als vrouw.

### 2. "Putem vorbi despre asta calm?"
**Betekenis:** Kunnen we hier rustig over praten?

**Uitspraak:** *poe-tem vor-bie des-pre as-ta kalm*

Uitnodiging voor kalmte.

### 3. "√én»õeleg punctul tƒÉu de vedere, dar..."
**Betekenis:** Ik begrijp je standpunt, maar...

**Uitspraak:** *un-tse-leg poenk-toel tuh de ve-de-re, dar*

Erkenning voordat je je mening deelt.

### 4. "Am nevoie de un moment sƒÉ mƒÉ calmez"
**Betekenis:** Ik heb een moment nodig om te kalmeren

**Uitspraak:** *am ne-vo-je de oen mo-ment suh muh kal-mez*

Ruimte vragen.

### 5. "Nu asta am vrut sƒÉ spun"
**Betekenis:** Dat is niet wat ik bedoelde te zeggen

**Uitspraak:** *noe as-ta am vroet suh spoen*

Misverstanden ophelderen.

### 6. "Te rog, ascultƒÉ-mƒÉ"
**Betekenis:** Alsjeblieft, luister naar me

**Uitspraak:** *te rog, as-koel-tuh-muh*

Vraag om aandacht.

### 7. "Po»õi sƒÉ-mi explici cum te sim»õi?"
**Betekenis:** Kun je me uitleggen hoe je je voelt?

**Uitspraak:** *pots suh-mie eks-plietj koem te siemts*

Toont interesse.

### 8. "Nu vreau sƒÉ ne certƒÉm pentru asta"
**Betekenis:** Ik wil hier geen ruzie over maken

**Uitspraak:** *noe vree-ao suh ne tsjer-tuhm pen-troe as-ta*

Signaal voor de-escalatie.

### 9. "SƒÉ gƒÉsim √ÆmpreunƒÉ un compromis"
**Betekenis:** Laten we samen een compromis vinden

**Uitspraak:** *suh guh-siem um-pre-oe-nuh oen kom-pro-mies*

Samenwerking voorstellen.

### 10. "√émi pare rƒÉu cƒÉ am ridicat vocea"
**Betekenis:** Het spijt me dat ik mijn stem verhief

**Uitspraak:** *umie pa-re ruh kuh am rie-die-kat vo-tsja*

Excuses aanbieden.

### 11. "Asta e foarte important pentru mine"
**Betekenis:** Dit is heel belangrijk voor mij

**Uitspraak:** *as-ta je foar-te iem-por-tant pen-troe mie-ne*

Benadrukt het belang.

## Culturele context

**Familie:** Familie is heilig in Roemeni√´. Kritiek op familieleden kan gevoelig liggen.

**Gastvrijheid:** Roemenen zijn enorm gastvrij. Eten en drinken delen is een manier van verbinden.

**Emotionele expressie:** Passie in discussies is normaal en toont betrokkenheid.

**Traditionele waarden:** Hoewel moderniserend, zijn traditionele genderrollen nog zichtbaar in sommige families.

## Conclusie

Met deze Roemeense zinnen kun je moeilijke gesprekken voeren terwijl je de warmte en verbinding behoudt die zo kenmerkend zijn voor Roemeense relaties.

articles.title: Italian Making Up & Reconciliation Phrases for English Speakers
articles.content:
Italians are known for passionate relationships‚Äîand passionate reconciliations. When you're with an Italian speaker, knowing how to make up in their language shows your heart is truly in it. Here are essential Italian phrases for those meaningful moments of reconnection.

## Apologizing Sincerely

### Mi dispiace tanto
**Pronunciation:** mee dees-PYAH-cheh TAHN-toh

**Meaning:** "I'm so sorry"

**When to use it:** A heartfelt apology. "Tanto" (so much) adds emotional weight.

### Perdonami
**Pronunciation:** pehr-DOH-nah-mee

**Meaning:** "Forgive me"

**When to use it:** A vulnerable, direct request for forgiveness.

### Ho sbagliato
**Pronunciation:** oh zbahl-YAH-toh

**Meaning:** "I was wrong" / "I made a mistake"

**When to use it:** When clearly taking responsibility.

### Non avrei dovuto dire quello
**Pronunciation:** nohn ahv-RAY doh-VOO-toh DEE-reh KWEL-loh

**Meaning:** "I shouldn't have said that"

**When to use it:** When regretting specific words from the argument.

## Expressing Your Feelings

### Odio quando litighiamo
**Pronunciation:** OH-dyoh KWAHN-doh lee-tee-GYAH-moh

**Meaning:** "I hate when we fight"

**When to use it:** To express how much conflict bothers you.

### Mi manchi quando siamo cos√¨
**Pronunciation:** mee MAHN-kee KWAHN-doh SYAH-moh koh-ZEE

**Meaning:** "I miss you when we're like this"

**When to use it:** To express longing even when you're physically together.

### Mi fa male quando siamo arrabbiati
**Pronunciation:** mee fah MAH-leh KWAHN-doh SYAH-moh ahr-rahb-BYAH-tee

**Meaning:** "It hurts me when we're angry"

**When to use it:** To share emotional pain from the conflict.

## Reaching Out

### Possiamo parlare?
**Pronunciation:** pohs-SYAH-moh pahr-LAH-reh

**Meaning:** "Can we talk?"

**When to use it:** To break the ice and begin reconciliation.

### Voglio sistemare le cose
**Pronunciation:** VOH-lyoh see-steh-MAH-reh leh KOH-zeh

**Meaning:** "I want to fix things"

**When to use it:** To show commitment to resolution.

### Possiamo ricominciare?
**Pronunciation:** pohs-SYAH-moh ree-koh-meen-CHAH-reh

**Meaning:** "Can we start over?"

**When to use it:** When you want to reset and move forward together.

## Expressing Love and Commitment

### Ti amo, questo non cambia
**Pronunciation:** tee AH-moh, KWES-toh nohn KAHM-byah

**Meaning:** "I love you, that doesn't change"

**When to use it:** To reassure your partner that love endures.

### Sei pi√π importante di questa lite
**Pronunciation:** say pyoo eem-pohr-TAHN-teh dee KWES-tah LEE-teh

**Meaning:** "You're more important than this fight"

**When to use it:** To prioritize the relationship.

### Non voglio perderti
**Pronunciation:** nohn VOH-lyoh PEHR-dehr-tee

**Meaning:** "I don't want to lose you"

**When to use it:** To express how much the relationship means.

### Siamo una squadra
**Pronunciation:** SYAH-moh OO-nah SKWAHD-rah

**Meaning:** "We're a team"

**When to use it:** To remind each other you're on the same side.

## Moving Forward

### Come possiamo evitare questo in futuro?
**Pronunciation:** KOH-meh pohs-SYAH-moh eh-vee-TAH-reh KWES-toh een foo-TOO-roh

**Meaning:** "How can we avoid this in the future?"

**When to use it:** To focus on growth together.

### Prometto di fare meglio
**Pronunciation:** proh-MET-toh dee FAH-reh MEH-lyoh

**Meaning:** "I promise to do better"

**When to use it:** To commit to positive change.

## The Italian Art of Making Up

Italians often reconcile with as much passion as they argue. Physical affection‚Äîembraces, kisses, touching‚Äîis natural and expected. Don't hold back on warmth.

Food frequently plays a role in reconciliation. Cooking together or sharing a meal can be a meaningful act of restoration.

Emotional expression is valued over emotional restraint. Letting your partner see how much you care‚Äîthrough words, tone, and actions‚Äîmatters deeply.

## Returning to Amore

After making up, sweet words restore the emotional foundation. "Amore mio" (my love), "tesoro" (treasure), and "ti amo" (I love you) remind your partner that love is what matters most. Italian reconciliation isn't just about ending conflict‚Äîit's about celebrating that your love is stronger than any disagreement.
